title.narrative: NIHR Humanitarian Food Aid for IDPs in Kirkuk Province

description.narrative: Many of the beneficiaries of this programme have fled their homes in federal Iraq (many of them displaced more than once) leaving behind their livelihoods, their education, and most of their worldly goods. The immediate relief provided by NIHR in this programme provides them with sufficient basic food items (according to SPHERE standards of calories per person, per day) to ensure that their basic food needs are met for a short time (estimated 1 month per family of 6 for 1 kit) to help them avoid negative coping strategies (including prostitution, crime, and excessive borrowing), and affording some level of dignity to families in desperate need of relief items.

The overall goal is to alleviate suffering through immediate food aid assistance to targeted IDP households, through provision of food and health kits. This project will provide food security for 400 families (Kirkuk Province/ Kirkuk city center / area of Tariq Co. and Al-Mansour area village of Umar Ibn Al-Khattab); 400 families will receive assistance items (reaching 2400 individual people (Disaggregated as 1450 female and 950 male beneficiaries). This is based on an average family size of 6 members). Christian Aid local consultant will coordinate CA’s partners’ programmes on the ground and will also support partners to ensure there is coordination with other actors in the broader emergency response programmes being implemented by other agencies.
